docs.lead_paragraph: China's crackdown on corruption in the pharmaceutical sector has frightened foreign executives so much that some fear they could be jailed and have asked their lawyers if they should leave the country for six months. Others are thinking of going for good.

headline.main: Spooked by Probes, Pharma Executives Ask: Should I Leave China?
headline.print_headline: Spooked by Probes, Pharma Executives Ask: Should I Leave China?

docs.lead_paragraph: Partisan and ideological polarization has grown dramatically in the last two decades, according to a survey of more than 10,000 Americans conducted by the Pew Research Center. A look at five findings that help explain the nation's political fissures:

docs.lead_paragraph: An Arizona woman was recovering at home on Wednesday after having a 47.5-pound (21.5 kg) tumor removed from her abdomen during life-saving surgery, doctors said.

headline.print_headline: Arizona Woman Has Nearly 50-Pound Tumor Removed From Abdomen

docs.lead_paragraph: Three million people, three times the estimate, have enrolled in health insurance through private exchanges, according to the consulting firm Accenture.

headline.main: Private Health Care Exchanges Enroll More Than Predicted
headline.print_headline: Big Gains in Private Health Care Exchanges as More Enroll Than Predicted

docs.abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser; data shows employers are moving more quickly than predicted to offer health insurance to their workers through private exchanges; three million people signed up for workplace health coverage for 2014 through private exchanges, systems that are separate from state and federal health insurance marketplaces.
docs.snippet: Three million people, three times the estimate, have enrolled in health insurance through private exchanges, according to the consulting firm Accenture.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal lawsuit filed Wednesday challenges Seattle’s adoption of what would be the nation’s highest minimum wage as unfair to small franchises.

headline.main: Washington: Franchise Group Sues Over Higher Wages
headline.print_headline: Washington: Franchise Group Sues Over Higher Wages

docs.lead_paragraph: An entrepreneur says she started her company, which does mailings, after a former employer rejected her offer to run its operations and improve them.

headline.main: ‘My Previous Bosses Are Now My Customers’
headline.print_headline: ‘My Previous Bosses Are Now My Customers’

docs.abstract: You're the Boss blog; interview with Sherry Stewart Deutschmann, chief executive of printing and mailing company LetterLogic; Deutschmann describes why she quit her job to start a company that competes with her old company.
docs.snippet: An entrepreneur says she started her company, which does mailings, after a former employer rejected her offer to run its operations and improve them.
